Reviews.Title: “good location & good price”
Reviews.Author: nc-turkiye
Reviews.Content: In my second stay in Joli, like the previous one, I felt comfortable. It is near to Vatican and you can go old city center easily either by 30 minutes walk or by bus. Best combination of safe location, clean rooms and good price. Bathroom is small but it is OK if you are not expecting luxury. The hotel stuffs are helpful and smiley. Breakfast is not in the hotel but in a very near cafe, including a croissant and a hot drink. I am sure that in my next visit to Rome, I will be stay in Joli again :) PS: 1- Stayed in October and in April 2- If you like live jazz, I certainly suggest AlexanderPlatz Jazz Club very near to hotel.

Reviews.Title: “good for this price”
Reviews.Author: Monika V
Reviews.Content: the hotel is so close to Vatican, less than 10 minutes walk...awesome, helpful staff...bathrooms are a little bit small and some rooms do not have them at all but you can not complain, price and location great...breakfast around corner in small cafe place....more food options would be great

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money!”
Reviews.Author: beebards
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel to be basic, clean, friendly and a great location. The rooms were large and you got your own bathroom. The free breakfast was at a little cafe round the corner, you could order a croissant and a hot drink. We thought the room and the added breakfast was great value for money. Thanks Joli Hotel for a great stay in Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Possibly the best value for money hotel I have ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: Amanda r
Reviews.Content: Fabulous little hotel - a couple of minutes walk from The Vatican and St Peters square, the rooms were spacious and clean, the shower always hot. the staff were friendly and helpful, and the Dolce Vita cafe that supplied our daily breakfast served the best croissants I have ever tasted. We will miss everything about this hotel - even the rickety lift (That fortunately never let us down). Will definitely stay here again when we come back!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly service, great room.”
Reviews.Author: Miqals
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located just steps from the Vatican. The rooms are large and clean. The staff was very polite and helpful with all our questions. Thanks to them for a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great location! Everything else is average.”
Reviews.Author: Muscovite505
Reviews.Content: The funny thing is that I actually booked a hotel called Florida but I received a confirmation from a hotel called Joli. Since the address was the same, I thought that the hotel had changed the name. Then it turned out that these are 2 different hotels! Florida is on the 2nd floor and Joli is on the 6th. At first Joli seemed dark and scary (we arrived late in the evening) but in broad daylight it seemed ok. The staff is very friendly and helpful, the rooms are clean but there is no division between smoking and non-smoking rooms. Our room was definitely smoking and the smell was obvious. But since we kept the window open at all times, it didn't bother us too much. The bathroom is one big shower cabin which sucks. After taking a shower you can enter the bathroom only barefoot. Apart from that, Joli is good value for money though I'd rather stay in a different hotel next time.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: EmTomm
Reviews.Content: This place split between two is basically the same price as a hostel, but you get your own bathroom and free breakfast. Not a place to stay if you wanna meet people, like in a hostel, but if you're traveling with a friend it's perfect! We felt safe and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “friendly familyathmosphere - good value for money”
Reviews.Author: norling11
Reviews.Content: This family run hotel/pension is a very nice place to stay in Rome. All rooms with a shower/toilet/tv and a comfortable bed. Actually here is all you need - at a very attractive price. You can walk to all attractions all over the city but there is also a bus just outside the door. It´s just a short walk from the busshuttle from Fiumicino Airport. The very nice people working here provide a perfect service. I have been here now for 3 times - and I will go there again next year for sure. I can highly recommend the hotel to other Rome-tourists. I am from Denmark and we have no problems communicating - in english. The hotel is situated in a very busy shoppingstreet going from Piazza del Poppolo to the Vatican. A beautful area. And there is a funny thing about the elevator in the building - the hotel is on the 6th floor. If you don´t close the doors properly - the elevator doesn´t work and it can really make you breathless to climb all the way up there. But I´m so much looking forward to come back there again. A good advice, don´t drink your coffee at Piazza Risorgimento (end of the street by the Vatican) - it´s 4 times as expensive as in other good cafés.

Reviews.Title: “Very close to Vatican but just average!”
Reviews.Author: travelqueen83
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very close to the Vatican you can walk there in about 5 mins which was handy, however Rome's other sites are dotted all over the place and hard to locate as you have to take the underground and the sites aren't actually near the stops. The underground is about a 10 min walk from the hotel... The breakfast is o.k its a donut or croissant and tea which you can take away or eat at the cafe- the first day we went there was no electric so we had a very small juice (so small you would give to a child!) The hotel is on the top floor of a building and you have to go up in a small very old elevator (scary to say the least!!) The lobby is very dark and cold, the staff speak little English. The rooms are quite large but very dated and freezing cold!!I had a room on the front of the hotel and it was very noisy, I intially picked it because I wanted a view of St.Peter's Basilica but you had to lean right out to get a look-so it's best to have room in the back for the peace! The hotel was just average and I would probably suggest staying in a Best Western which is where I would normally stay

Reviews.Title: “A Roman Motel 6”
Reviews.Author: Travisman
Reviews.Content: Hotel Joli was nice for the price. It was sort of a mom and pop operation. The hotel was located on on floor of the building, with apartments and another hotel located on other floors. The room was clean. The bed was comfortable. The staff really went out of their way to help us. The location was great. The Vatican was a short walk. The Metro line was close by. It had some limitations: a weird bathroom and old school elevator. I wouldn't recommend special occassions like a Honeymoon, but for a traveler on a budget it was great.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Ann189894
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Joli in Rome for 7 nights. We didn't expect so much because of the low price. When we arrived we met a very nice receptionist who welcomed us and gave us some information. The room was clean and comfortable. We had read about the tiny bathrooms, but our bathroom had a perfect size. The roof fan was a bit noisy so one afternoon when we came back to our room we was informed that they had put a fan at the floor. We hadn't complained at all, they noticed the problem themselves when they were cleaning one morning. Every morning we had to walk to a very nice and familiar café, just around the corner, for breakfast, coffee and a croissant. That was OK for us. It's perfect to stay at this hotel. It's so close to everything, if you don't want to walk it is easy and cheap to go by bus or Metro.

Reviews.Title: “A Joli time was had”
Reviews.Author: mikegreen
Reviews.Content: Stayed 21-25th June 2010. Hotel is situated on a popular and pretty street, about ten minutes walk from the Vatican & St Peter's Square (two of the major Rome 'must do's' in the tourist manual!). We appreciated the less frenetic feel of this part of town even though the aforementioned places are such a draw for visitors. Arrived a little early to check-in so went for a wander and returned at the appointed time. Hotel is located on the sixth floor of a rather grand looking block of apartments. Came back and were greeted by a friendly receptionist who gave us the key (Room 45) as well as tokens for a breakfast (nice local cafe just around the corner, two minute walk) and a map of the city with the hotel marked on it. We found our room to be perfectly acceptable for the Joli's star rating. Everything was clean and functional. Bed was comfy, two singles joined together but not the type that induces a nightime slip between the gap between the two beds! Shower and toilet/bidet was in essence a wet room and although not at all luxurious, you don't get luxury at these prices in Rome, was fine. TV and ceiling fan too lest we forget. In essence a really good choice if you are willing to accept the 'limitations' of a budget hotel and instead focus on the location and charm of the area it is located in. Apologies for the awful picture which is the view from the room we stayed in, we were too busy to think much of snapping the hotel itself!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money”
Reviews.Author: Serban27
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 4 nights, we had a splendid view on the Basilica San Pietro. The rooms are pretty big and were cleaned every day, staff very friendly and helpfull. The breakfast is served at a cafe, about 3 minutes away from the hotel. The hotel itself it's not very stilish, but it's a great starting point in visiting the major turistic atractions in Rome. You have Piazza San Pietro and the Vatican Museums about 10 minutes away, same for Castel S'angelo, Piazza Navona and The Panteon about 20 minutes walk. For the rest of the sites, you can take the metro ( station Ottaviano) and it will take you to all the rest ( Piazza del Popolo, Fontana di Trevi, Piazza di Sapgna, Colosseum, etc). A pass for three days costs 11 EUR, and the transport is fast. Also, about the hotel, it must be said that the rooms have a very small bathroom with no ventilation, except a small fan. A 5 minute shower with warm water steams up the room guaranteed. Apart from that, be advised that the breakfast if formed from a coffe or tea and a croissant, which is the general breakfast for all italian people. Also, be advised, that this is family run hotel, and if you plan on staying out after 1 am, you have to ask for the key at the entrance.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and great value for money. Perfect for the Vatican”
Reviews.Author: Macca2010Leeds
Reviews.Content: Me and my wife have just got back from our honeymoon. We stayed for 3 nights at the Joli Hotel. We chose the hotel for its location and value for money, we were not disappointed. It is a stones throw from the Vatican and St Peter's Square. The hotel its self is on the 6th floor of an apartment building, a bit hard to spot at first. Once we arrived we was greeted by the friendly staff, who showed us our room and told us about the gate downstairs (as one reviewer spoke of earlier) they explained that the gate is locked after 1am, but if you are out later than that let them know and they will give you a key (after all its a small family hotel and they do need to sleep). Also some people in earlier reviews complained about the breakfast. This again was explained in full to us. You get a ticket which you take to a cafe around the corner where they exchange it for a continental breakfast (Croissant and coffee) It is a 2 to 3 minute walk and about 2 streets away, not 10 minutes (the other reviewer must have gone the opposite way) It is a lovely little cafe, proper Italian feel to it.. We found the Joli Hotel extremely lovely for its price range. The room was adequate and comfy, with the basics of a bed, wardrobe, tv and bathroom. What else do you need, we was there to sightsee not sit in a hotel room al day. If you want luxury go somewhere else and pay a lot more. If you want to be in a beautiful area close to the Vatican and surrounding area with friendly staff and a comfy bed to sleep in at a bargain price, then this is the Hotel for you. One thing to mention about travel in Rome, get a ROMA Pass, bargain for tourists.

Reviews.Title: “Run the other way!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: special_dayz
Reviews.Content: Having booked this as a budget holiday for myself and my partner before our wedding, we didnt expect much but from the moment we arrived it was a disappointment. Only one member of staff was pleasant and helpful. Dank dark rooms, Tiny Bathrooms, when we asked for tea we were given milk that was off, when my partner went to request another one he was told they were finished for the day....at 5 in the evening. Breakfast was to be served in the pub next to the hotel.....not the case, a good ten minute walk away.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic location. extremely friendly & helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: wesleyboo
Reviews.Content: Before arriving was slightly concerned about some bad reviews but this was soon laid to rest. The room was really nicely presented, very clean and with a comfy bed. The hotel staff answered any questions we had about breakfast, directions to tourist attractions etc. On our last day in Rome they allowed us to leave our luggage at the hotel and saved us having to pay to put it into left luggage at the main train station. Also each time we returned to our room from a day out, the room had been cleaned, new towels provided and complimentary items had been left e.g. Nutella and little chocolates! I cant praise them enough! The location was ideal, well within walking distance of major attractions. We could see the dome of St. Peter's basilica from our room window and it is a stones throw away.

Reviews.Title: “It was fine”
Reviews.Author: MimiNorthGeorgia
Reviews.Content: The staff was pleasant - the rooms were fine - it was within walking distance of the Vatican & plenty of places to eat..

Reviews.Title: “Good sleeping in Joli”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Nice comfortable hotel, well located, bus stop in front. BUT: don't accept room nr. 40, because it is located near the reception and you will awake very early by guests checking out. The staff of the hotel was very helpful to me: after one night, I got another, spacious room for the rest of the week. Daily cleaned. Small bathroom. Hardly any streetnoices thanks to dubbleglassed windows. Interesting old fashioned elevator. I liked our stay in this hotel!

HotelInfo.Name: Joli Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Via Cola di Rienzo, 00192 Rome, Italy
